refnamediv.refpurpose: Compute default table column widths for CALS tables

refsection.para: If non-zero, CALS tables will have a computed width for every column, even if the table doesn't specify any widths. By default, CALS table columns are all of equal width in the absense of any width specification.
If this feature is disabled, no computed width will be specified, leaving the layout at the discretion of the rendering engine. In HTML, the rendering can be influenced by CSS rules.
If the table specifies any table column widths, this parameter is ignored and computed widths will be provided for every column.
